item.title: Nintendo ‘Close to You’ videos revealed as first short films created by Nintendo Pictures
item.content:encoded:
• Nintendo

"Nintendo Pictures will continue to explore new creative possibilities through video content."

The Pikmin-themed “Close to You” animated videos released by Nintendo this week are the first short films created by Nintendo subsidiary Nintendo Pictures, Nintendo announced.

“We hope you enjoyed the two ‘Close to You’ videos released on October 7 and [October] 8,” Nintendo said. “The second video is available on Nintendo Today!, a free app available on your smart device. These are the first short films created by Nintendo Pictures Co., Ltd. Nintendo Pictures will continue to explore new creative possibilities through video content.”

item.title: Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade & Rebirth Twin Pack PS5 physical edition announced
item.content:encoded:
Square Enix will release a physical edition of Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade & Rebirth Twin Pack for PlayStation 5 on December 4, the company announced.

Previously only available as a digital bundle, Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade & Rebirth Twin Pack includes both Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade and Final Fantasy VII Rebirth.

Here is an overview of each game, via Square Enix:

Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade

Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade is the first game in the Final Fantasy VII Remake Trilogy, and is set entirely in the city of Midgar.

This circular steel city is built on the power of mako—the planet’s lifeforce, which is processed and turned into energy by the Shinra Electric Power Company.

The story begins when mercenary Cloud Strife joins the anti-Shinra resistance group Avalanche on a mission to destroy one of their mako-siphoning reactors. It’s meant to be a one-time gig, but before long Cloud is sucked into an adventure that puts him on a collision course with a dark figure from his past: Sephiroth.

It’s a fast-paced tale that combines action and spectacle with powerful character moments. The iconic party of Cloud, Barret, Tifa, and Aerith are portrayed in greater depth than ever before—and by the time the credits roll, you’ll love them like friends.

The action’s pretty great too though. The combat system fuses intense real-time action with menu-based commands—in other words, the exhilarating action of a modern action game with the deep strategy of a turn-based RPG.

As well as the main Final Fantasy VII Remake story, the Intergrade edition of the game also includes “EPISODE INTERmission.” This two chapter tale takes place concurrently with the main campaign and stars fan-favorite ninja Yuffie Kisaragi.

With a new character to control, new parts of Midgar to explore and the endlessly entertaining Fort Condor minigame, it’s an essential play before you head into the next game in this pack…

Final Fantasy VII Rebirth

The second game in the remake series follows Cloud and his comrades as they step out of the city of Midgar and into the wider world in pursuit of their enemy, Sephiroth.

This globe-trotting tale is full of amazing stories and unforgettable places—the war-torn region of Junon, the glitz and glamor of the Gold Saucer, the verdant forests of Gongaga and much more.

New playable party members join the team too. You’ll take control of Red XIII, Yuffie and Cait Sith, each offering new playstyles and abilities in battle. In battle, you can use new Synergy abilities that let characters team up to deliver powerful attacks.

The world of Final Fantasy VII Rebirth also provides plenty of diversions and opportunities for a talented mercenary. You can take on side jobs, scour the world for valuable intel, battle powerful fiends, play a few hands of the card game Queen’s Blood, become a chocobo jockey in fast-paced races, take on the many challenges of the battle simulator and much more.

In short, it’s an incredible game—there’s a reason it won more than 40 Game of the Year awards in 2024!

item.title: Sacred 2: Fallen Angel Remaster launches November 11
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Priced at $19.99 on PC, $29.99 on consoles.

Sacred 2: Fallen Angel Remaster will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on November 11, publisher THQ Nordic and developers SparklingBit and Funatics announced. The PC version will cost $19.99 / € 19.99 and support multiplayer gameplay, while the console versions will cost $29.99 / €29.99 and only support single-player.

Here is an overview of the game, via THQ Nordic:

About

Ancaria stands on the brink. T-Energy, the mysterious power source that once brought prosperity, now fuels corruption, conflict, and chaos. In the midst of war and betrayal, six heroes rise—each with their own fate, abilities, and path through a living, breathing open world.

In this remaster of the beloved action RPG Sacred 2: Fallen Angel, players return to a massive fantasy realm filled with hundreds of quests, dangerous dungeons, and unique combat arts to master. Battle monstrous creatures, uncover ancient secrets, and shape your character through loot, leveling, and deep customization.

With refined combat mechanics, a modern user interface, full controller support, and all expansions included, the remaster brings new life to a fan-favorite—whether you’re revisiting Ancaria or setting foot in it for the first time.

Forge your legend. The fate of Ancaria awaits.

Key Features

  • Includes all expansions and updates in one definitive edition.
  • Smoother, more responsive combat.
  • Modern user interface and full controller support.
  • Enhanced textures, lighting effects, and view distance.
  • Community-driven fixes and improved stability.

item.title: Bloober Team announces release calendar, including Layers of Fear: The Final Masterpiece Edition for Switch 2 and I Hate This Place delay
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

I Hate This Place delayed to January 29, 2026.

Bloober Team has announced its release calendar for its upcoming projects, including the reveal of Layers of Fear: The Final Masterpiece Edition for Switch 2.

The companies release schedule is as follows:

  • Layers of Fear: The Final Masterpiece Edition (Switch 2) – A complete edition of the Layers of Fear series due out in 2025.
  • I Hate This Place (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch, PC) (from subsidiary Broken Mirror Games) – Delayed from its previously planned November 7, 2025 release date to January 29, 2026.
  • Project F (from subsidiary Broken Mirror Games) – Due out in 2026. Details to be announced.
  • Project M (Switch 2, Switch) (from subsidiary Broken Mirror Games) – A Nintendo platforms-exclusive title due out in 2026. Details to be announced.
  • Star Trek: Infection (formerly Project I, second-party) – A virtual reality survival horror game set in the Star Trek universe, due out for Quest 3 and SteamVR on December 11, 2025.
